New Records: The Yankees are American League champions for the first time since 2009.
Giancarlo Stanton moved ahead of Judge and Babe Ruth on the Yankees’ career postseason home run list with his 16th playoff homer in pinstripes.
Key Match Events: Juan Soto hit a three-run homer off Hunter Gaddis in the top of the 10th inning.
Giancarlo Stanton hit a two-run shot off Tanner Bibee in the sixth inning to tie the score.
Luke Weaver tamed the bottom of the Guardians order in the ninth inning and set down the top of the order in the 10th to clinch the pennant.
Emmanuel Clase retired Aaron Judge and Giancarlo Stanton in a scoreless ninth inning.
Post-Match Reflections: General partner Hal Steinbrenner expressed pride in the team's resilience, stating, 'We had our ups, we had our downs, but we never had our doubts.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: Emmanuel Clase rebounded with a scoreless ninth inning after struggling in previous games.
Tanner Bibee delivered the longest outing by a Cleveland starter this postseason on short rest.
A costly base-running blunder by the Yankees in the first inning prevented them from breaking the game open early.
